title: Thunderbird mail on Android phone
content:
I have been using Thunderbird as my mail service for many years, using it on the PC and my smartphone. Since several weeks ago, for an unknown reason, the "SENT" folder on the smartphone shows all the messages which were sent, but not with the correct name of the person/organization to who the email was sent. All my messages in the "SENT" folder are recorded as having been sent to "Lucie Payant" with a picture of her avatar, instead of showing the name of the real correspondent.

However, the "SENT" folder on my PC is fine and shows the correct correspondent to whom the email was sent to.

I verified all my settings, and, as far as I know, everything seems correct on my cell. This situation is very annoying and confusing.

Can you help me please. Raymond

title: Close to tray only when I click X (Thunderbird 145)
content:
Hi, is there a way to get Thunderbird to move to the tray when I press the X button in the top right corner?

I've tried enabling "When Thunderbird is minimized, move it to the tray" but that just changes what the minimize button does. When I press X, Thunderbird still quits.

I've done some googling and I found this extension: https://services.addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/minimize-on-close/

The problem with it is:

  1. It doesn't seem to work with modern versions of Thunderbird
  2. It lets you either minimize the window or move it to the tray, but not both (X and minimize do the same thing)

Can I get Thunderbird to close to tray only when I press X? So that the minimize button still works normally? Thanks

title: Problema invio email
content: Buongiorno, scrivo per chiedere supporto in merito a un problema che negli ultimi mesi sto riscontrando in modo saltuario durante l’utilizzo di Thunderbird per l’invio delle email. La mia casella è ospitata su Aruba, ma utilizzo Thunderbird per la gestione quotidiana della posta. Ho già contattato l’assistenza Aruba, che dopo le loro verifiche mi ha confermato che lato server non risultano anomalie e mi ha quindi suggerito di rivolgermi a voi per ulteriori accertamenti. Il problema che riscontro è il seguente: da questa estate, in modo irregolare e non prevedibile, alcune email che invio da Thunderbird sembrano partire correttamente in quel momento, ma poi non arrivano ai destinatari. Inoltre non compaiono nemmeno nella mia cartella “Posta inviata”, né risultano in altre cartelle (posta in uscita, posta eliminata, ecc.). È come se alcune email, sporadicamente, si “perdessero” dopo l’invio. La maggior parte dei messaggi viene inviata senza problemi, ma in alcuni giorni può capitare che più email consecutive non vengano recapitare e non risultino più tracciabili: ad esempio, questa estate ho avuto un episodio in cui 5–6 email inviate nello stesso giorno non sono mai arrivate e non sono presenti nella posta inviata. Per cercare di monitorare la situazione avevo creato una cartella dedicata e inserito il mio indirizzo in copia nascosta, così da verificare la corretta consegna, ma non posso controllare ogni messaggio manualmente. Inoltre, anche con questo metodo, recentemente è ricapitato che una mia email non risultasse essere stata inviata né ricevuta. A questo punto avrei bisogno del vostro supporto per capire: se si tratta di un problema noto o già segnalato da altri utenti; se ci sono impostazioni o configurazioni in Thunderbird che potrei modificare per evitare che le email “scompaiano”; se esiste un metodo di diagnostica o log che potrei attivare per aiutarvi a identificare la causa. Il problema è purtroppo sporadico, ma impatta la mia operatività, poiché non posso ogni volta controllare manualmente se ogni email è stata effettivamente inviata. Vi ringrazio in anticipo per l’attenzione e per qualsiasi indicazione possiate darmi.
creator: giulia5

title: Run Now button in Message Filters fails
content:
MY SYSTEM: Thunderbird 140.5.0esr running in Linux Debian Bookworm

I have created a filter from a recently received message via pop. The settings are: OK Manually Run OK Getting New Mail: Filter before Junk Classification

Match all of the following From Contains xyz.co.uk

Perform these actions: Move message to XYZ on my mailbox

Press OK

In the Message Filters window, Run selected filter(s) on: XYZ Press Run Now

There is no response, and all the messages remain in the Inbox.

I have repeated the Run Now process on an old filter (by moving the message back to the inbox), and that works fine.

The only oddity of the current message is that it is a no-reply message eg From = no-reply@xyz.co.uk

Any ideas welcome!

title: Installazione su Android
content:
Buongiorno, ho installato Thunderbird su tre dipositivi (Desktop, Tablet Android e smartphone android) ma non si parlano tra loro: se invio mail con desktop non è visibile sugli altri due dispositivi e viceversa, devo cancellare le mail tre volte (in pratica su ogni dispositivo). Thunderbird si comporta come se fossero tre programmi diversi. L'unica cosa che li collega è che se leggo una mail su un dispositivo risulta letta anche sugli altri. Inoltre con lo smartphone android ho delle difficoltà quando invio le mail: mi dice sempre che non sono inviate ma in realtà lo sono. Installati tutti con protocollo IMAP e seguendo le istruzioni indicate Rimango in attesa di Vs istruzioni/suggerimanti. Grazie Mauro


Good morning,

I installed Thunderbird on three devices (Desktop, Android tablet, and Android smartphone), but they don't communicate with each other: if I send emails on the desktop, they're not visible on the other two devices, and vice versa. I have to delete the emails three times (basically on every device). Each device is set to IMAP.

Thunderbird behaves as if they were three different programs.

The only thing that connects them is that if I read an email on one device, it appears read on the others.

I'm also having trouble sending emails on my Android smartphone: it always says they're not sent, but they actually are.

All installed with IMAP protocol and following the instructions indicated

I'm waiting for your instructions/suggestions.

Thank you.

title: Email List Columns Changing Widths on Thunderbird re-Opening
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 140.5.0esr (32-bit) on Windows 10 Pro Build 19045. After the last few updates the columns in the email listings are changing widths from what I've set them, this seems to happen after I close then reopen Thunderbird; which I'm having to do more often these days to resolve weird calendar malfunctions. For instance, the data column would appear so narrow that only the month/day show with "..." at the end, when I know I've looked at this yesterday with the full view of the date and time showing. I've reviewed my options and I've set them individually, set them globally and it makes no difference. Of course I've rebooted, etc. I have over a hundred local folders and they all change differently, of course some look the same but others don't. Most have the same column headings selected but it doesn't seem to matter. Some have the "Correspondents" column selected but many don't.

This is very irritating and I'd like to know why Thunderbird is doing this, and more importantly, how can I prevent this behavior in the future. Thanks,
creator: BPaul_H

title: “Messages appear in both Inbox and Trash (IMAP, multiple users)”.
content:
Hi,

we use Thunderbird for several business e‑mail accounts (for example info@… and similar), all configured as IMAP, and the same mailboxes are used by multiple people on several computers. Our mail server hostname is nickel.studio4web (Studio4web hosting).

We have noticed the following strange behaviour of messages (usually customer orders):

A new message arrives normally in the “Inbox” folder.

After some time, for example the next day, the same message also appears in the “Trash” folder, but it is still visible in “Inbox” at the same time.

We checked the headers; the Message‑ID field is exactly the same in both Inbox and Trash, so it looks like one and the same mail that exists in two folders at once.

In Thunderbird Server Settings we configured the delete behaviour so that messages are either moved to Trash or removed immediately (we tested both options), and after that we ran Compact on both the Inbox and Trash folders. However, some messages still remain simultaneously in Inbox and Trash.

We know that other team members open the same accounts in other clients / on mobile phones or in webmail, but we are not sure whether that alone can explain this double appearance of the same message (Inbox + Trash).

For example, two order emails from 03.12. were in Inbox only on that day, and today we see them also in Trash, while they are still in Inbox. No one remembers explicitly deleting them.

Questions:

Is this behaviour normal for IMAP in Thunderbird, or does it indicate some bug or wrong configuration?

Is there a way to prevent a single message from being present in both “Inbox” and “Trash” at the same time (so that it is either only in Inbox or only in Trash)?

What else should we check in Thunderbird settings or on the mail server (filters, special IMAP options, automatic cleanup, server‑side rules, etc.) to avoid such “duplicate” messages?

Environment:

Thunderbird version: 140.5.0esr

Operating system: Windows 11 Pro

Mail server / provider: nickel.studio4web (Studio4web hosting)

Thanks in advance for any help and advice.
creator: soskic

title: Migrate from one mac to another, and thunderbird is broken
content:
I migrated one mac, which was intel based, to another, which is M4. It all went fine. I have the same versions of OS and Thunderbird on each, before the migration. The new machine is a 2025 Mac Studio. The old machine is a 2018 Mac Mini, 6 core Intel Core.15

On the old machine in Thunderbird, under my user, all my files are listed. On the new machine, files are not listed.

I saw a lot of information/suggestions to replace the Profile folder under: USER/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles And I copied it straight over from the old machine, with negative results.

I did notice that under profiles, it continues: m8mojurw.default-esr/Mail/Local Folders/ where there are some other goodies, some of which are "documents".

however, on the new machine, those same files are there, except they are "unix executable files"

I have migrated many times over the years and this hasn't happened.

I have done all of the suggestions I found so far, such as the Profile copy/past, reinstalled Thunderbird from scratch, looked thru comparisons of the Account Settings....

Oh, a couple more things:

If I look under my user and go to "Account settings" then "copies & folders" to looks different on the 2 machines. The old machine has: a check next to "Place a copy in" and under that a dot for "Sent folder on:" and my user name. On the new machine there is: "Place a copy in" and I cannot write into the "sent folder on" space, I can only select Choose and Account -> Local files as if the user doesn't exist (?) Thanks

title: nella mia casella di posta thunderbird ha cancellato in automatico messaggi vecchi della posta arrivata, perchè?
content: nella mia casella di posta thunderbird ha cancellato in automatico messaggi vecchi della posta arrivata, perchè? I messaggi li avevo scaricati dal server di aruba in locale sul mac. Purtroppo nel settaggio di thunderbird c'era settato il cancellamento dei messaggi dal server dopo 12 gg. e ora ho settato di non cancellarli mai, ma i messaggi dalla webmail di aruba non ci sono più. Il problema è che me li ha cancellati anche thunderbird in locale nella posta arrivata del computer. E' perchè c'è un settaggio per il sincronismo in automatico con le mail residue sul server? E dunque dopo che Thunderbird ha autorizzato aruba a cancellarle, Aruba le ha cancellate e poi thunderbird le ha cancellate dalla sua posta in arrivo perchè si è sincronizzata col server di Aruba che dunque le aveva tolte? Non capisco veramente perchè comunque thunderbird le abbia tolte tra le mie mail arrivate sul mio computer locale. Potete aiutarmi? come posso recuperare le mail che in precedenza erano state scaricate dal server di aruba? Cosa può essere successo nel frattempo? c'è modo di accedere a qualche vecchio backup locale? Grazie
